intro: Casparia lunarioides, commonly known as the moonflower plant, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, white, nocturnal blooms that open at dusk and close at dawn. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces fluffy, cotton-like seeds that are dispersed by wind. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. The botanical features of Casparia lunarioides make it a unique and attractive addition to gardens and natural habitats.
